summary:
Lesotho, officially the Kingdom of Lesotho, is a small, landlocked country in southern Africa, completely surrounded by South Africa. It's known as "The Mountain Kingdom" because it's located in the Maloti Mountains and has the highest peak in southern Africa. The country is home to about two million people, with the Sotho ethnic group making up almost all of the population. 

Lesotho was created in 1824 by King Moshoeshoe I and became independent from British rule in 1966. Today, it faces challenges like poverty and HIV/AIDS but also has high literacy rates and universal primary education. It's a member of the United Nations and other important organizations.
title: Lesotho
